greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n, A276086(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: A276086(n) = { my(i=0,m=1,pr=1,nextpr); while((n>0),i=i+1; nextpr = prime(i)*pr; if((n%nextpr),m*=(prime(i)^((n%nextpr)/pr));n-=(n%nextpr));pr=nextpr); m; };
(PARI) A324198(n) = { my(m=1, p=2, orgn=n); while(n, m *= (p^min(n%p,valuation(orgn,p))); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 21 2019
xref: Cf. A324583 (positions of ones), A324584 (and terms larger than one).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 25 2019
